text.title: Prevent a Computer from Waking Up from External Devices

p.s: If you 've experienced your computer suddenly turning itself on after you 've put it to sleep or you 've just shut it down , you may need to investigate what ’s causing it to wake up .
The common causes that wake up your computer are hardware devices and scheduled tasks set to wake up the computer .
You might not even know that this has been happening especially if you have closed the lid of your laptop and did n't notice the lights blinking again .

head.s: Determining the Possible Causes for the Wake Up

item.s: Access the Command Prompt .
Click on the Start menu and look for the Command Prompt application .
This is usually found under the Accessories folder .
Click on it to launch it , and a window with a DOS-like environment will be opened .

figure.rend: Prevent a Computer from Waking Up from External Devices Step 1 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Check the last wake trigger .
On the Command Prompt , type in “ powercfg – lastwake ” and then press the Enter key .
The Wake History details will be displayed .

figure.rend: Prevent a Computer from Waking Up from External Devices Step 2 Version 2.jpg

item.s: If the Wake History Count is more than 0 , that means your computer was woken up by something .
Note the wake source .
If the Wake History Count is not 0 , the Wake Source details will also be displayed .
The Wake Source will state what caused your computer to wake up .

figure.rend: Prevent a Computer from Waking Up from External Devices Step 3 Version 2.jpg

item.s: For example , if a device attached to a USB port was the source , USB Root Hub will be displayed .

head.s: Preventing Devices from Waking Up the Computer

item.s: Access the Command Prompt .

figure.rend: Prevent a Computer from Waking Up from External Devices Step 4 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Check devices .
To see the list of hardware devices that can wake up your computer , type in “ powercfg -devicequery wake_armed ” on the Command Prompt and then press the Enter key .
The list of hardware devices will be displayed .

figure.rend: Prevent a Computer from Waking Up from External Devices Step 5 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Some possible devices that can wake your computer include , but is not limited to , your keyboard and your mouse .
Note the devices .
Take note of the list of hardware devices that can wake up your computer .
You will need to configure them properly in the Device Manager .

figure.rend: Prevent a Computer from Waking Up from External Devices Step 6 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Open the Control Panel .
Click on the Start menu and click on “ Control Panel . ”
The Control Panel applets will be displayed .

figure.rend: Prevent a Computer from Waking Up from External Devices Step 7 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Open the Device Manager .
Browse through the items under the Control Panel and look for “ Device Manager . ”
Click on it .
The Device Manager will be opened and the list of hardware devices for your computer will be displayed .

figure.rend: Prevent a Computer from Waking Up from External Devices Step 8 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Look for the devices .
Navigate through the Device Manager until you find the possible devices that may cause your computer to wake up .
Click on the triangle icon beside each device to expand the category .

figure.rend: Prevent a Computer from Waking Up from External Devices Step 9 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Open the Device Properties .
Right-click on the device you want .
Select “ Properties ” from the menu to bring out the device ’s properties .

figure.rend: Prevent a Computer from Waking Up from External Devices Step 10 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Disable Wake Up property .
From the Device Properties window , select the Power Management tab . Untick “ Allow this device to wake up the computer ” option .

figure.rend: Prevent a Computer from Waking Up from External Devices Step 11 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Click “ OK ” to save your changes and exit .
The selected device will no longer wake up the computer .
Disable all other devices ’ wake up properties .
Repeat Steps 6 to 8 to disable all possible devices that can wake up your computer .
If left enabled , sudden or accidental movements that affect these devices can wake up your computer .

figure.rend: Prevent a Computer from Waking Up from External Devices Step 12 Version 2.jpg

head.s: Preventing Tasks from Waking Up the Computer

item.s: Open Command Prompt .

figure.rend: Prevent a Computer from Waking Up from External Devices Step 13 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Check wake timers from tasks .
To see the list of scheduled tasks that have set wake timers , type in “ powercfg – wake timers ” on the Command Prompt and then press the Enter key .
The list of scheduled tasks will be displayed .

figure.rend: Prevent a Computer from Waking Up from External Devices Step 14 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Wake timers wake up your computer at the defined time for it to run the scheduled tasks .
This can be useful if you want to run certain tasks on schedule , even without you monitoring them .
Note the tasks .
Take note of the list of scheduled tasks that can wake up your computer .

figure.rend: Prevent a Computer from Waking Up from External Devices Step 15 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Uninstall programs or adjust schedules .
From the list of scheduled tasks , check which ones you really need .
Uninstall or remove the ones you do n’t need , and adjust the schedules for the ones you do .

figure.rend: Prevent a Computer from Waking Up from External Devices Step 16 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Set a schedule that ’s good for you and your computer .
Adjusting the scheduled tasks can be done from the Windows task scheduler or directly from each of the programs .
Open Control Panel .
Click on the Start menu and click on “ Control Panel . ”
The Control Panel applets will be displayed .

figure.rend: Prevent a Computer from Waking Up from External Devices Step 17 Version 2.jpg

item.s:
Open “ Power Options .
”
Browse through the items under the Control Panel and look for “ Power Options . ”
Click on it .
The Power Options will be opened .

figure.rend: Prevent a Computer from Waking Up from External Devices Step 18 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Change the plan settings .
Your computer ’s power plans will be displayed .
Click on the “ Change plan settings ” link beside the power plan you ’d like to modify .

figure.rend: Prevent a Computer from Waking Up from External Devices Step 19 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Change advanced power settings .
Look for the “ Change advanced power settings ” link and click on it .
The Advanced settings for the Power Options will be displayed .

figure.rend: Prevent a Computer from Waking Up from External Devices Step 20 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Disable wake timers .
Navigate through the list of settings until you find “ Sleep . ”
Click on it to expand its properties .

figure.rend: Prevent a Computer from Waking Up from External Devices Step 21.jpg

item.s: Under Sleep , click on “ Allow wake timers ” to expand it further .
Set both properties under it to Disable .
No wake timers will now be able to wake up your computer .
